Dottie Myers-Hill

Greetings Camper Families!!!

I am proud to be back as your Camp Director in 2016. Another year of learning in the off season will lend itself to a well prepared summer staff and more fun and magic for your children! My favorite things about camp are watching campers during Thought and Campfire, sharing stories or songs or skits. I love hearing the sounds of children chattering, singing and laughing all around me at any given time of day. My most favorite thing is watching timid young souls at registration blossom into best buddies and struggle to say goodbye to their new friends on Saturday mornings. I also love watching new staff start out a little timid each season and grow into seasoned leaders by summer’s end. The transformations are sometimes amazing. My history with VBYC started as a high school student at Leadership in 1980. I was a counselor, program staff member, Head Counselor, Morning Cook, Assistant Director and Director in my first 12 years out here. Since then, I have been mostly in Restaurant Management where my love for learning was encouraged every day. I also have served on the VBYC Board of Directors for most of the 20 years I was away. I live in Kalamazoo with my kids, my husband Brian, and three cats...soon to add a bunny? My son, Zak, a freshman at MSU, and daughter Kenzie, a sophomore, at Loy Norrix, have been campers here since they were little. I continue to love what I do. I still learn something new every day. I love doing that with your campers and my staff. I love the quiet beauty of VBYC in the spring and the fall and the anticipation of a new season to come. I am a happy camper!!

post_excerpt: Map of Van Buren Youth Camp

This range includes an arrow stop, bag targets, clearly designated shooting lines, and a covered shooting platform. Archery class is taught by a certified instructor who uses clear safety signals and range commands to control the course activity. *Rifle and Archery Ranges are located across the road from Main Camp for safety of participants and the general Camp population.

post_content: The Upper 20 is a 20 acre land plot just down the road from the main camp. It has an enclosed pavilion with bunks for sleeping and a soccer/football field perfect for large group activities, sports and band camps. This is also the location of our Nature Trail. Pioneer campers make their campsite here.
Our volleyball pit is located by the waterfront, always ready for a match.

Our private beach, dock and swim area is on the shores of Great Bear Lake, a small private lake. The swim area is divided into three sections to serve a range of swimming ability, and is guarded by certified lifeguards and our WSI-certified waterfront director. At their disposal are all necessary rescue equipment including a motorized rescue boat and rowboat.

post_content:
Dottie Myers-Hill

Greetings Camper Families!!!

I am proud to be back as your Camp Director in 2016. Another year of learning in the off season will lend itself to a well prepared summer staff and more fun and magic for your children! My favorite things about camp are watching campers during Thought and Campfire, sharing stories or songs or skits. I love hearing the sounds of children chattering, singing and laughing all around me at any given time of day. My most favorite thing is watching timid young souls at registration blossom into best buddies and struggle to say goodbye to their new friends on Saturday mornings. I also love watching new staff start out a little timid each season and grow into seasoned leaders by summer’s end. The transformations are sometimes amazing. My history with VBYC started as a high school student at Leadership in 1980. I was a counselor, program staff member, Head Counselor, Morning Cook, Assistant Director and Director in my first 12 years out here. Since then, I have been mostly in Restaurant Management where my love for learning was encouraged every day. I also have served on the VBYC Board of Directors for most of the 20 years I was away. I live in Kalamazoo with my kids, my husband Brian, and three cats...soon to add a bunny? My son, Zak, a freshman at MSU, and daughter Kenzie, a sophomore, at Loy Norrix, have been campers here since they were little. I continue to love what I do. I still learn something new every day. I love doing that with your campers and my staff. I love the quiet beauty of VBYC in the spring and the fall and the anticipation of a new season to come. I am a happy camper!!
